subject: JUnit4: TestListener questions
msgSnippet: I m implementing a sample TestListener. I ve encountered a number of unclear points I wanted to ask about. Here s the interface: package org.junit.runner;
messageBody:
I'm implementing a sample TestListener. I've encountered a number of
unclear points I wanted to ask about. Here's the interface:

package org.junit.runner;

import java.lang.reflect.Method;


public interface TestListener {

void testRunStarted(int testCount);

void testRunFinished(Runner runner); //TODO: Something is wrong here...
Should take an event anyway

void testStarted(Object test, String name);

void testFinished(Object test, String name);

void testFailure(Failure failure);

void testIgnored(Method method);

}


1. What is the first argument passed to the testStarted and testFinished
class? I assume this is the actual test object which in JUnit 4 can
extend any class. Is it really helpful to pass this given that it's only
an object of unspecified type and in practice may have any type?

2. Why does testIgnored() get a Method when testFailure gets a Failure?
Should there be an Ignored class? Or should testFailure take a method
instead? These two feel out of sync.

3. Does testFinished always bracket testStarted? i.e. does
testFailure/testIgnored go in between started and finished or does it
replace testFinished?


--
